item.title: CS135-lecture-20210310
item.description: Context-free grammars # Recall, for regular languages: regular expressions are generators, and finite automata are recognizers. Context-free grammars are the recognizers of context free languages. Any string we can make in this process is in the language. Any string we can’t make in this process is not in the language. So \( \{a^n b^n: \text{n is integer}\} \) is context free. Remember, we couldn’t describe this language using regular expressions because finite automata don’t have memory.
